approach: Union-Find: 1) Each element (e.g., email) starts as its own group. 2) Union: Merge any two elements that belong to the same group (e.g., two different emails under the same account). 3) Find: Find all elements (e.g., emails) that belong in the same group (e.g., same account)
time_complexity: O(n log n) (dominated by sorting of emails for each account; Union-Find operations are considered as O(1))
